column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Become an Eclectic or Independent Music Beacon
#Text=It can be a daunting task , building a large , eclectic and interesting play list .
#Text=This is an entirely subjective guide to how to be happier , more elitist and more impressive , on a tiny budget , without illegal downloading .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Start with a couple favorite bands that you already like .
#Text=This is usually an option .

#Text=It 's generally best if you already like one of the historically important old indie rock bands listed below , mainly if you are going for the all-encompassing eclectic-indie kind of play list that is so very rewarding .
#Text=However , if you , right now , fit into the Warnings category , you have to start somewhere on the road to cool-geekdom ( it 's the best way to superficial popularity there is ! ) .
#Text=If you do n't already , buy at least one full album each by at least three of the bands listed below .
#Text=Make sure you actually like the bands .
#Text=Read up on the bands you 've chosen using the sources listed in Tips .
#Text=Pay attention to the movement , genre or scene the band is considered a part of , and even more attention to any given similar-artists type information .
#Text=Look up whatever related bands you can find .
#Text=This is important .
#Text=Listen to them if possible .
#Text=Start making a list of albums to buy , or just bands to look for .
#Text=Keep reading about the history of the bands !
#Text=Not the members or the dates of course , but the influences and music and genre .
#Text=Never be intimidated by bands you 've never heard of , especially not old ones .
#Text=If someone is talking to you about a band you do n't know , ask them .
#Text=Go to small venue concerts whenever possible .
#Text=Who cares if you know the band ?
#Text=Develop your own tastes .
#Text=Find your own bands .
#Text=Try to focus on a niche genre while also building your overall collection .
#Text=Jazz .
#Text=Noise rock .
#Text=Experimental .
#Text=Delta blues . Lounge . Soul .
#Text=Crust punk .
#Text=There are so many weird bands out there , what are you waiting for ?
#Text=No one will ever think you are cool because you listen to loud music .
#Text=Remember that metal is the most popular form of music as far as sales go .
#Text=" Just because it 's loud does n't mean it 's good . "
#Text=If you go to a noise rock concert , seriously , wear earplugs .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Last . fm and Pandora.com are great ways to find new music you like .
#Text=Here 's their description of themselves :
#Text=" Pandora is a music discovery service designed to help you find and enjoy music that you 'll love .
